title: News regarding PropCo REIT
story_body:
PropCo REIT Appoints New Senior Vice President of Asset Management

PropCo REIT (NYSE: PROP) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Chen as Senior Vice President of Asset Management, effective November 1. Chen will oversee the company's portfolio of retail and office properties across the Midwest region, reporting directly to Chief Operating Officer Michael Thompson.

Chen joins PropCo from Meridian Property Group, where she served as Director of Portfolio Management for five years. She brings over 15 years of experience in commercial real estate asset management and previously held positions at CBRE and Jones Lang LaSalle.

"Jennifer's extensive background in retail property management will be valuable as we continue to optimize our portfolio performance," said Thompson in a statement. "Her expertise aligns well with our strategic objectives for the Midwest markets."

In her new role, Chen will be responsible for managing relationships with key tenants, overseeing property-level budgets, and implementing operational improvements across PropCo's 2.3 million square foot Midwest portfolio.

Additionally, PropCo announced that several members of its executive team will attend the upcoming National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts (NAREIT) Annual Conference in Las Vegas from November 14-16. Chief Executive Officer David Martinez is scheduled to participate in a panel discussion on "Regional REIT Strategies in a Changing Market" on November 15.

The company also launched a new sustainability initiative focused on reducing water consumption across its properties. The program, dubbed "PropCo Blue," aims to decrease water usage by 10% over the next three years through the installation of low-flow fixtures and smart irrigation systems at select properties.

"Water conservation is an important component of our environmental stewardship efforts," said Sarah Williams, PropCo's Director of Sustainability. "This initiative demonstrates our commitment to responsible property management while also reducing operating costs."

PropCo REIT owns and operates 127 properties totaling approximately 8.4 million square feet across 15 states. The company's portfolio consists primarily of neighborhood shopping centers, single-tenant retail properties, and suburban office buildings.

Shares of PropCo closed at $24.32 yesterday, up 0.3% for the day. The stock has traded between $22.15 and $26.78 over the past 52 weeks.
